conclusion: The particle is injected at an angle of 45 degrees to the vertical.
Initial velocity components: v0x = v0/sqrt(2), v0y = v0/sqrt(2).
The particle follows a circular path due to Lorentz force in the magnetic field.
Vertical velocity component remains unchanged; horizontal component reverses direction upon collision.
The particle traces semicircular paths before and after each collision with the plate.
Total horizontal distance covered by the particle is 2d, implying two semicircular arcs.
Diameter of each semicircle equals 2r, leading to 2r sqrt(2) = 2d.
Radius of circular path: r = d/sqrt(2) = d sqrt(2)/2.
Using the formula for radius: r = mv/qB.
